unit: Unit 7 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Means
title: Conditions for Matched Pairs $t$-Test
question_text: Which of the following are necessary conditions for conducting a matched pairs $t$-test?
solution:
Statements I and II are necessary conditions. For Statement II, it is important to remember that a matched pairs test is not as concerned with the distributions of the two separate populations, rather we are interested in the distribution of differences.

Statement III is a necessary condition when conducting a $z$-test for a population proportion, not a mean.
